texto: 7.1.3 Limitations and cautions Descriptive statistics provides quantitative measures of the characteristics (such as the average and spread) of sample data that are sometimes then used as estimates of the population. However, these measures are subject to the limitations of the sample size and sampling method employed. The conclusions are subject to meeting certain assumptions about the population. © ISO 2021 – All rights reserved  ﻿ 11 ISO 10017:2021(E) ﻿
